Technique: PRESSED IN A FORM/MODEL ?; PAINTED; FAYENCE
Name: Triad
Description: This small plaquette in faience is equipped with a grooved hole for suspension, which indicates that it served as an amulet. It represent the classic triad of the goddess Nephthys, of Horus the child and the goddess Isis. The piece, which was part of the Ã‰. de Meester de Ravestein collection, dates from the Late Period.
